channel.title: Need help with this lame compiler -.-
channel.description:
Looked everywhere cannot find what i need.
I got me a 508 'Berky-scape' its nice, i tried to compile i get the message 'Press any key to continue...' Most servers say 'Finished!' but this did not and i went in game and nothing had changed, i tried making myself admin, i did what i needed to but its not compiling for some reason, So help please!

item.title: Need help with this lame compiler -.-
item.dc:creator: @Motokid126 Motokid126
item.description:
@Motokid126 wrote:

Alright, thanks.

I just tried another server with the same base just different client etc, its laggy but it all worked i changed name, and made myself admin i just odn’t know why this one isn’t working

stil isn’t working

Read full topic

item.source: Need help with this lame compiler -.-

item.title: Need help with this lame compiler -.-
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

Bloody hell, don’t listen to people who don’t know what there saying…

Press any key to continue means it’s saved.

remember to re-run your server to take effect.

[quote=“Syfal, post:14, topic:327414”]Here is Taharok’s “Perfect” Compiler. It works every time I use it:

[code]
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
:: ::
:: This Compiler is under no licenses and may ::
:: be distributed freely. ::
:: ::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit
[/code][/quote]Dont give him a bloody 317 compiler…

I used berky-scape “press any key to continue” means it worked.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @delicious delicious
item.description:
@delicious wrote:

Try this…

Open up a command prompt.

Type "cd " and drag the folder that has all the .java files in it.

Press enter.

Type javac *.java

Thats a manual way of compiling.

item.title: Need help with this lame compiler -.-
item.dc:creator: @Motokid126 Motokid126
item.description:
@Motokid126 wrote:

[quote=“Syfal, post:14, topic:327414”]Here is Taharok’s “Perfect” Compiler. It works every time I use it:

[code]
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
:: ::
:: This Compiler is under no licenses and may ::
:: be distributed freely. ::
:: ::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit
[/code][/quote]

Thanks but im still getting this error:

javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with this lame compiler -.-

item.title: Need help with this lame compiler -.-
item.dc:creator: @Syfal Syfal
item.description:
@Syfal wrote:

Here is Taharok’s “Perfect” Compiler. It works every time I use it:

::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
::                     ::
::   This Compiler is under no licenses and may   ::
::   be distributed freely.            ::
::                     ::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
"%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Read full topic
